Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2012 02:26AM xercisefreak wrote: Love it, thank you for taking the time to post this wonderful news. I needed this today. Thank you mamabee!
Posts.Title: Positive nodes with long term survival many Lily55

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2012 04:37PM xercisefreak wrote: Hi, I am 39 years old and finished chemo in February of this year.  Had six TAC chemo treatments every three weeks.  I thought it was very doable.  Drove myself to all treatments and I lived an hour away.  Didn't have radiation, so can't comment as to that.
Posts.Title: Chemo for ER+PR- her2- Ergirl Rose12

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2012 05:04PM xercisefreak wrote: Hello Ergirl! I took all the steroids they gave me to take before each treatment and I took lots of vitamins (turkey tail mushroom supplements), swear they helped.  Never had nausea, but sooooo tired.  Did the treatments on a Thursday and a neulasta shot on Friday.  Stayed in bed all weeked because I was so tired.  But fine by Monday morning.  Didn't do alot of housework but still able to take care of four year old.  Hope this helps!  You can do chemo, whichever kind you decide.  Take care! Ruthbru - you are my hero.  You are so positive and upbeat, I follow your posts alot!  Glad to see you are doing good and so far out from your treatment.  Take care as well!
Posts.Title: Chemo for ER+PR- her2- Ergirl Rose12
